Text:
New Year’s Day in Seward overlooking the harbor. Beautiful but icy (note the parking lot and ice cleats on my Xtratufs) 
Further down the highway it’s waterfalls of ice that get your attention. https://t.co/VRiTUKr5XS
Happy #NewYear!

I championed provisions to strengthen Alaska’s economy, accelerate workforce development, & support military members and their families. This includes the nearly $500 million in Congressionally Directed Spending I secured to benefit over 130 community-driven projects in Alaska.
December: As senior Appropriator, I helped write major parts of the FY23 omnibus bill, and secured significant funding and assistance for Alaska throughout it. https://t.co/M3IHYLRl3U

December: Congressman Don Young’s legacy will live on in many ways, and thanks to the Don Young Recognition Act, the most active volcano in the Aleutian Islands named after him—a fitting representation of the always-active, sometimes unpredictable Congressman for all of Alaska. https://t.co/6IYJRHlpxO

November: I have long supported marriage equality and believe all lawful marriages deserve respect. I was proud to vote for the bipartisan Respect for Marriage Act as all Americans deserve dignity, respect, and equal protection under the law. https://t.co/kAnAyiQYW7

October: It was great to be in Anchorage with so many Alaskans at the @NativeFed Convention. From increased broadband, water and wastewater investments, to improved climate resilience and storm recovery—I was proud to share the work we’ve done to support Alaska Native communities https://t.co/w0HPSYNADR

September: @SenatorDanSullivan, @Rep_Peltola @GovDunleavy, & I were united in advocating for Alaska to have as much immediate support as possible and our efforts paid off—welcoming announcements that @potus issued a major disaster declaration to support Western Alaska’s recovery. https://t.co/yhC1rs4OxR

September: This fall, Typhoon Merbok produced widespread damage to communities in Western Alaska. I headed to impacted communities – Elim, Nome and Golovin, and was joined by Representative Peltola in a visit to Hooper Bay and Chevak – to see firsthand the extent of the damage. https://t.co/418J1A8vSE

August: During a visit to Air Station Sitka, @ComdtUSCG of the @USCG, recognized me as an honorary Chief Petty Officer of the USCG, a title given only to individuals who demonstrate the highest commitment to the Coast Guard's core values. https://t.co/V5pAoe9IjD

July: The Federal Transit Administration made $300 million available for ferries. The funding, made possible by the bipartisan infrastructure law, will support rural ferry systems and build out electric ferries in Alaska. https://t.co/bUu0KHMNxE

June: @SenDanSullivan and I attended the U.S. Army Alaska’s re-designation as the 11th Airborne Division at Fort Wainwright in Fairbanks and Joint Base Elmendorf-Richardson (JBER) in Anchorage. https://t.co/uBzYsoQqCb

May: I had the privilege of joining the Memorial Day ceremony at Byers Lake, an honored tradition I’ve taken part of for the past two decades, put on by Veteran Motorcycle Clubs across Alaska. It’s so important to give our veterans the respect and honor they deserve. https://t.co/kJQdJ4fHvp

April: In April, I hosted over 1,100 Alaskan leaders for an Infrastructure Grant Symposium, to share opportunities for their communities that exist within the transformational bipartisan infrastructure law. https://t.co/cYzcMrnU4Q

March: The FY22 Omnibus package included $230 million I secured for over 65 Alaska projects—and provided significant support for public safety efforts with the reauthorization of the bipartisan Violence Against Women Act (VAWA) I helped lead. https://t.co/YDZk8Xnn4m

February: I joined @Sen_JoeManchin on CNN’s State of the Union—hosted by Jake Tapper—where we discussed the importance of bipartisanship and putting Alaskans and Americans first. https://t.co/nEsoUWU1Kv

January: Projects across Alaska—including $250 million for the Port of Nome, $185 million for the Lowell Creed flood diversion project, and $25 million to fix the Denali Park Road—received significant funding thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure law. https://t.co/1RyA4z21KI
Happy New Year Alaska! Here’s a quick look back at some noteworthy moments over the past year ⬇️🧵
These U.S. Army 2022 #YearinPhotos featuring Alaska’s glowing northern lights and U.S. Veteran Wayne Porter were incredibly moving. Thank you to the @USArmy for sharing.

The cost to heat homes in Alaska remains among the highest in the nation. I’ve dedicated my time in the Senate to creating lasting solutions for Alaskans. From investing in energy efficiency to supporting the LIHEAP program, the FY23 omnibus is helping lower energy costs. https://t.co/r2LVwHHRpY

Across the state, workforce development is one of the most important issues in each community. The FY23 omnibus package includes funding for programs that create opportunities for Alaskans to fill critical jobs and strengthen our workforce. https://t.co/uF1YkC9DIN

Alaska’s fisheries and oceans are at the core of our history, identities, and economies. In the FY23 omnibus I’m proud to have secured many wins for Alaska’s coastal communities and food producers. https://t.co/8CNdRn4JHb
From my family, to yours: Merry Christmas, Happy Holidays, and a Happy, Happy New Year, Alaska! https://t.co/yBk8aQXIFM
Merry Christmas Eve from beautiful and snowy Girdwood 🎄❄️ https://t.co/mvXdCGEZGR
I’m wishing all Alaskans a Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays. https://t.co/IiQaGeUwjz
Thanks to all the Alaskans who shared their own #AlaskaChristmasTree with me. Each and every one of your trees are so special 🎄 https://t.co/GegR6Ev2wq

If newspapers don’t survive in a social media world, what will I wrap my Aunt’s nativity scene in? Most of these papers are over a decade old (and some of the news still seems the same!) https://t.co/mV4PvV4OeA

I’m not ready for Christmas. I just got back home from wrapping up the 117th Congress and now I get to work making Christmas happen - cause that’s what moms do. The tree gets decorated today. I’m so thankful to be back in Alaska, to celebrate with friends and family. https://t.co/egwLBphJFJ

During this holiday season, I hope you’re able to spend time enjoying all your favorite traditions. One of mine is decorating the Christmas tree w/ Alaskan ornaments.

Alaskans: post a photo of your #AlaskaChristmasTree in the comments & I might re-share it on my social media!🎄 https://t.co/pDNbPPzCXL
We’re all getting in the holiday spirit here at the Murkowski office! I hope all Alaskans—and your dogs—are enjoying the season! 🎄🐾 https://t.co/caigPWELBn

Amid the good news of the omnibus, I’m not forgetting that today marks nine years since @Interior rejected a life-saving road for King Cove. They’ve endured a stunning 197 medevacs since that awful decision. Let’s #buildtheroad in 2023 and finally protect the people of King Cove. https://t.co/Stqrljce4z
As a Senior member of the Senate Appropriations Committee, I worked hard to direct investments to over 130 projects across Alaska. https://t.co/M49aEUztbv

Congressionally Directed Spending upholds Congress’ Constitutional duty to determine how taxpayers’ money is spent and allows Alaskans to have a say in where their dollars go.

https://t.co/KaxbjN4OSX

Read my full statement here ⬇️

https://t.co/Wn9HAeoWdJ

I voted in favor of the Consolidated Appropriations Act for Fiscal Year 2023, an omnibus package that funds the federal government through September 30, 2023. As a senior Appropriator, I helped write major parts of the bill and secured significant wins for Alaska.
As a senior member on the Appropriations Committee, I was proud to secure major wins for Alaska.

Today, the Senate passed the FY23 omnibus appropriations package—which included significant funding priorities for Alaska, including provisions to support military readiness, workforce development, public safety, education, food security, fisheries, wildfire mitigation, and more. https://t.co/LXoi3mL1F8

Members of the Alaska Guard work hard to serve and protect Alaskans—regularly putting their lives on the line in service of others. I’m proud we secured significant wins in this year’s NDAA to support them and enhance their ability to carry out their mission. https://t.co/5rwOOi6Qns

Hundreds showed up to the recent Kabayan Inc Filipino-American Community of Mat-Su’s Christmas Gala, where Kabayan Inc. celebrated another successful year of advocacy & service to the Filipino-American community. Thank you to President Lhing McNeal & Kabayan Inc. for all you do. https://t.co/syuYsEBvRc
Happy #wintersolstice, Alaskans! Looking forward to gaining back a little daylight each day.
Following a meeting at the White House about the Willow Project on Alaska’s North Slope, @SenDanSullivan, @Rep_Peltola and I released the following joint statement: https://t.co/lq7BUDa7JQ

Within this year’s NDAA I helped secure a commercially available @USCG icebreaker capable of operating in the Arctic—a region with ever-growing geostrategic significance. Growing a fleet of icebreakers will be critical to keeping pace with the evolving region. https://t.co/VQlevQKKS6

Last night, the Senate confirmed Diane Kaplan to be a Member of the Board of Directors of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting until 2026! I look forward to seeing Diane continue her advocacy on behalf of Alaskans. Congratulations, Diane!
I love Alaska.

Within the current FY2023 Omnibus bill, we included legislation I helped craft to reform & modernize the Electoral Count Act of 1887. I’m proud to have been part of this effort & thank my colleagues who put in the work to help restore vital trust in our Electoral College system. https://t.co/SQKqvVfHS2

Good news! The Senate unanimously approved 8 Indian Affairs bills. 3 of the bills will head to the President’s desk to be signed into law, including the Don Young Alaska Native Health Care Transfers Act.
 
Learn more here ⬇️ https://t.co/3jqyOAmm6p

From base installation improvements and equipment upgrades to supporting new military construction projects and port and harbor projects – because of this year’s NDAA, Alaska will see significant investments to defense related infrastructure. https://t.co/DlM2eHZTrc

Military sexual trauma can have a tremendous impact on an individual’s mental and even physical health. That’s why I cosponsored the VA Peer Support Enhancement for MST Survivors Act, which recently passed the Senate – to ensure folks have the support they need to heal. https://t.co/UYjQf3SYU5
This year’s NDAA authorizes military construction projects across Alaska, allowing for important upgrades to infrastructure on installations in our state. https://t.co/HkVdtXzidQ

Alaska’s oceans are key to our state’s livelihood and economy, which is why I worked hard to include several provisions to enhance the health & safety of our oceans and coastlines in this year’s NDAA. https://t.co/2Rstz1BMPw https://t.co/A68JoXJRUu

To ensure a high quality of life for our servicemembers and their families, a much-deserved pay raise for those who serve was included in this year’s NDAA.

This package is focused on supporting the physical, mental, and financial health of those who serve to protect. https://t.co/3GxFJsn7QH

I wish I could have been in Anchorage today to take part in the @specialolymak’s annual Polar Plunge, but I’m glad that members of my staff & friends were able to take part. The temp was hovering right around 1 degree Fahrenheit, but if anyone can handle the cold— it’s Alaskans! https://t.co/ifL2DVbYJZ

I’m proud major wins for Alaska’s Coast Guard were included in this year’s NDAA.

From efforts to improve the mental health of our Coasties to investing in icebreakers—the bill strengthens the @USCG's mission to serve and protect. https://t.co/lzLXEZ6k9s

The NDAA provides historic investments to our military by increasing our presence in the Arctic, improving quality of life for servicemembers & their families, investing in military infrastructure, and more.

This bill is critical to our national security and defense efforts. https://t.co/0d0g8LJMJc

Workforce shortages across the nation are presenting incredible challenges to employers. I commend Chief Scott Raygor of the Fairbanks Fire Department for thinking outside of the box to bring staffing to 100%. Keep up the good work, Chief!
Johnny Cash and I have been working hard in D.C. this week — although he’s gotten many more naps in than I have! https://t.co/k2JL2Ki9vc

Alaska fisheries have faced incredible challenges which are devastating to the industry, Alaskan families, & Alaska’s economy. I thank Secretary Raimondo for listening to the urgency of our request & granting disaster declarations for Alaska's fishermen. https://t.co/5KE4MUJdRT

I’m proud that the Don Young Arctic Warrior Act I championed was included in this year’s NDAA package, providing substantial support for Alaska-based servicemembers, their behavioral health resources, and the hardships that come with serving in the Far North. https://t.co/UOcQVTYSUh
‘Tis the season!

The NDAA just passed the Senate and is on its way to be signed into law. I proudly voted in favor of this critical legislation which supports military readiness, servicemember well-being, and recognizes Alaska’s unique strategic role in national security. https://t.co/WT1kRtWyjN

Congratulations to the 75 cadets who graduated the Alaska Military Youth Academy. After a rigorous 22-week program, these young Alaskans came out on the other side transformed into healthier, stronger, more disciplined individuals. I wish them luck in their next chapter! https://t.co/ZnNneoa5FG

More good news for Alaska as a result of the bipartisan infrastructure law: the EPA announced a total of $1 million in grants for the Alaska Forum and the Zender Environmental Health and Research Group in Alaska, to support environmental job training programs. https://t.co/pWQ6j7uKmb
The snowfall in Southcentral #Alaska over the last week has been unbelievable. I hope Alaskans (and their furry friends) stay safe. https://t.co/Ftc8hQ1mrY

Don Young’s legacy will live on in many ways: his family, his landmark legislative accomplishments, and now, the most active volcano in the Aleutian Islands named after him—a fitting tribute of the always-active, sometimes unpredictable, Congressman for all of Alaska. https://t.co/iQXOtt4hkh
I was thrilled when these F-35s arrived at their new home at @EielsonAirforce base. It’s even better seeing them in the sky.

Yuut is a prime example of why the return of Congressionally Directed Spending is so vital. I secured $10 million in the draft FY23 bill to help Yuut expand their main training building to support even more develop the skills necessary to keep Alaska moving forward.

Thank you to Yuut Elitnaurviat for your dedication to Alaska’s future & congrats to Kwadwo Nartey Adonu, Sonya Beaver, Minnie Carter Sharp, and Lawrence Martin, who just graduated from Yuut Elitnaurviat's nursing program. https://t.co/IARZTg8Wk4
Truly - #OnlyInAlaska! Again, huge thank you to all of the Alaskans helping to keep our roads clear and safe during this record-breaking snowfall.

Thanks to the Rasmuson family for supporting my bill to rename the "Alaska VA Clinic" to "Colonel Mary Louise Rasmuson Campus of the Alaska VA Healthcare System" after the late Colonel Rasmuson who significantly expanded opportunities for women serving in the military. https://t.co/H9FTIUG01X

As I continue to enact the successes of my Energy Act of 2020, and support all-of-the-above energy solutions that support Alaskan and American jobs and national security, I look forward to seeing the continuous development of nuclear fusion energy.
I’ve long supported the development of advanced nuclear technologies, and know this announcement demonstrates a promising future for cleaner energy systems.
Yesterday's announcement that researchers from @Livermore_Lab have produced energy through a fusion reaction is an exciting development in nuclear fusion energy capabilities.

Happy birthday to the @USNationalGuard! 
 
From their efforts in aiding western Alaskan communities following the impacts of Typhoon Merbok to their constant service and dedication to keep our nation safe, I am grateful for the Guard’s brave men and women.
 
#Guard386

Following Senate passage of my bill, the Don Young Recognition Act - which I led with @SenDanSullivan -  I spoke on the floor about the incredible legacy that the late Congressman Don Young left behind. 

Don is missed every single day. 
https://t.co/2Ll0HNuvXz

Our bill honors the late Congressman's career by designating a volcano in the Aleutian Island as Mount Young; the Federal office building in Fairbanks as the Don Young Federal Office Building; & the Job Corps Center located in Palmer as the Don Young Alaska Job Corps Center. https://t.co/popqLDR0vF

Yesterday, @SenDanSullivan and I celebrated Senate passage of our legislation, the Don Young Recognition Act. Don brought light and energy to every room he entered. He is missed every single day. https://t.co/xTTwopwxp5
Bringing a little #Alaska-themed Christmas cheer to my Washington, DC office. https://t.co/bx22keze6L

The current version of NDAA includes provisions from my bill the Don Young Arctic Warrior Act, an icebreaker for America’s @USCG, numerous military construction projects, support to expand the Port of Nome to accommodate a deep water port, & so much more. https://t.co/cTCmSt96mz
Due to the ongoing inclement weather, today's event has been cancelled, for the time being. If/when the event is rescheduled, I will re-share the information at that time.

I’m proud that my bill, which designates the name change from the “Alaska VA Clinic” to “Colonel Mary Louise Rasmuson Campus of the Alaska VA Healthcare System,” passed the Senate - a fitting tribute to Colonel Rasmuson and America’s female veterans. https://t.co/ADCieDjzmY

Hydro projects across Alaska are demonstrating innovative practices while powering neighborhoods & communities. I’m proud to help lead this legislation, which will facilitate investments in Alaskan projects, while protecting critical fisheries & waterways. https://t.co/pkaaVT8H2h https://t.co/3xofqBL8BI

Mom then proceeded to her life’s work, raising 6 kids, all while balancing a public role as supportive spouse to my dad. She has unlimited graciousness & patience and has taught me so much about loyalty, strength & love by how she has lived her life. Birthday blessings Mom! (2/2) https://t.co/CjE4b6W5Aj
To call my mom amazing is an understatement. Born in Nome, she was raised in Ketchikan with her 3 siblings, met my dad at KayHi and they married while still in college. (1/2) https://t.co/soPaJrmYu0

Alaskans are no strangers to winter conditions but this week, Southcentral Alaska experienced intense snowfall, with some areas reporting as much as two feet of fresh powder. Thanks to everyone working to clear the snow, dig out neighbors, & keep our roads safe for Alaskans.

Congrats to Major Emily Katz who served in my office as my 2022 @usairforce Legislative Fellow, and to all the other fellows, on their graduation. I thank Emily for her service to Alaska and our nation. I know she will continue to do great things in the future. https://t.co/qeqwnJFdHc

This Sunday-Monday, Dec. 11& 12, from 2-4pm the VA Alaska Health Care (1201 N. Muldoon in Anchorage) is holding a PACT Act event for toxic exposure screening and claims assistance. You can apply for PACT Act-related benefits: https://t.co/ceuTDySmBM

This year’s bill includes significant provisions that invest in military readiness, prioritize Alaska’s unique role in national security, and provide much-deserved support to our servicemembers and their well-being.
Now that the annual defense authorization bill has passed the House, I look forward to a swift passage of the NDAA here in the Senate.

I joined a bipartisan group of Senators in urging @DFCgov to finance nuclear energy projects to help reduce emissions, deliver global clean energy & help protect our core national security interests. Read our full letter here: https://t.co/plbqAatDDZ

Congratulations to the City of Gustavus & Alaska Power & Telephone as they transition @Glacier_Baynp this week from relying on diesel to almost entirely relying on hydroelectric power. It was an honor to help get this project across the finish line.    https://t.co/UYpJsJhjyq

This week we gathered at the White House for the 2022 Holiday Ball. Of the many holiday traditions, seeing the White House at Christmas – the beautiful decorations and creativity – is a really special experience. It was great to be there with my niece. https://t.co/pNuaYuaiHR

More good news for Alaska from the Infrastructure Investment & Jobs Act! The communities of Kotlik, Point Hope, & Chilkat Indian Village, as well as the @Alaska_Wildlife & the @AKConservation have been awarded funding to improve climate resilience & invest in coastal habitats. https://t.co/eFjZMufAnF
Hope Alaskans are staying safe!

Today, on the 81st Anniversary of the attack on Pearl Harbor, we remember the brave military members who fought – and the many who gave their lives – in defense of our freedoms. #PearlHarborRemembranceDay https://t.co/NUeCeGL2yW

Multiple projects throughout the Kenai Peninsula benefit from the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law which I helped write & secure into law. This includes upgrades in Tyonek, Kenai River bluff stabilization, improvements at Lowell Point & USCG housing in Seward.https://t.co/OkqRmmU8Mi

On #NationalMinersDay, we recognize all those who responsibly develop resources that Americans rely on each day. Their dedicated work provides materials to pave roads, build houses, develop technology & more. Thank you to everyone who contributes to this important industry. https://t.co/wbu22XtImi

Thank you to the community of Nuiqsut for blessing Anaktuvuk Pass with a portion of their whale harvest as they face the challenges of food insecurity. Seeing Alaskans helping Alaskans — whole communities chipping in to help each other — makes me humbled and proud.

During a recent hearing, I questioned a BLM official about the agency’s actions, which run contrary to the law and have needlessly set this road back.
https://t.co/fHYPmdVq5S

Less than 50 miles of the proposed 211-mile Ambler Access Project is routed across federal land w/ the rest owned by the State of Alaska or AK Native Corporations. Yet the @BLMNational continues to ignore federal law to thwart pre-construction activity for this important project.
Thanks to the @AKNationalGuard for this special annual tradition—a great way to spread holiday cheer in remote Alaska.

I’m happy to have met Bennet Lane from Eagle River, a student & leader at the Job Corps center in Palmer who visited DC for a leadership summit. I’m a big fan of @DOLJobCorps & all that they do, so I’m excited to see what students like Bennet can achieve through these programs. https://t.co/Bw19drltb3
Suggesting the termination of the Constitution is not only a betrayal of our Oath of Office, it’s an affront to our Republic.
Congratulations to Eve Stephens on making Seawolves history after being named the Ron Lenz D2CCA National Player of the Year. Your hard work and dedication is inspiring!

This season we celebrate 100 years of a classic holiday tradition— the National Christmas Tree Lighting Ceremony in DC. A special thanks to the @NatlParkService for hosting this annual celebrations and for keeping America’s National Parks pristine! Happy Holidays! https://t.co/x7wjdoAoAH

The STOP Act – a bill Sen @MartinHeinrich & I’ve led for several Congresses – unanimously passed the Senate. This bill will provide the tools to put an end to illegal trafficking of tribal relics & artifacts & restore those items to their rightful owners https://t.co/E71MoRtMVZ

The Senate passed a resolution to prevent a railway strike that would have cost the U.S. economy an estimated $2 billion per day, disrupted supply chains, harmed public health, and negatively impacted consumers and businesses—including in Alaska. https://t.co/Mr40Mt208R

Earlier today, I questioned an official from the Department of Energy about this. I requested more information about what the misuse of the SPR means for its integrity, and how much additional maintenance will wind up costing taxpayers. https://t.co/4j9xcFGBTo

The Biden administration’s sale of 180 million barrels of oil from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve has harmed our ability to respond to a true supply disruption—but it has also degraded SPR’s salt caverns and driven up the costs of maintenance.

As we wrap up Military Family Appreciation Month, I am reminded of the commitment and sacrifices made by the families of our nation’s service members. Thank you to our military families—we are forever grateful! https://t.co/JZ30C1iRUy

I met w/ Maj Gen (Ret.) Randy "Church" Kee and his team from the Ted Stevens Center for Arctic Security Studies - the first Arctic DoD regional center. After years of work to make this center a reality, it was encouraging to hear about their progress. https://t.co/LfMFAzmqEy

The December 1st deadline to apply for this spring’s Senate Page Program is coming up quick! Alaskans, if you are a high school junior between 16-17 years old with at least a 3.0 GPA – or you know someone who might be interested – visit my website below. https://t.co/K7xJ8GmoA2
Today we kicked off the holiday season with the annual Congressional Christmas tree lighting at the U.S. Capitol. Happy holidays everyone! https://t.co/llKWb4eHQp
I was proud to vote in favor of the Respect for Marriage Act, which just passed the Senate in a vote of 61-36.

As a senior member of the Appropriations Committee I included Congressionally Directed Spending in the proposed FY23 funding bills which would support more than 130 projects throughout Alaska. I’m doing everything I can to secure this support for Alaskans. https://t.co/H1cnuTBlm9

As Vice Chairman of @IndianCommittee I’m proud the Senate passed our bipartisan resolution, introduced with @SenatorSchatz, recognizing November as National Native American Heritage Month. Together, we celebrate the diverse cultures, traditions, & histories of Indigenous peoples. https://t.co/kvNZCAF8QV
The majority of businesses in Alaska are small businesses. They are huge economic drivers for our state. Today, on #SmallBusinessSaturday, I encourage everyone to #buylocal! https://t.co/9vQ2ETrEw5

I’m pleased that @USDA has listened to my encouragement to add more fish to WIC food packages. This is good news for moms and babies across the country. If you’re interested in reading the rule and commenting on it, more details are available here. https://t.co/7dwy2UmzwY

Denali Elementary School was nominated to be the the National ESEA Distinguished School in Alaska. Congrats to the students for their outstanding academic achievements as well as the school’s faculty & staff for their continued support for education. Keep up the great work!

This season is a reminder of the things we have to be thankful for and to take time to reflect on the many blessings we have in our lives. I am particularly thankful to be from a great state filled with incredible people.
Happy Thanksgiving and stay safe. https://t.co/cH1y1Hc4S3
#OnlyInAlaska — thanks to all involved for making this a successful rescue.

An overwhelming number of youth & children experience homelessness. I’m joining a group of Senators with the goal of bringing more attention to this issue by introducing a bipartisan resolution to designate November as National Homeless Children and Youth Awareness Month. https://t.co/u1OVA3CSqh

During an Energy & Natural Resources Cmte nominations hearing for key positions at @ENERGY such as Under Secretary of Energy for Infrastructure, I spoke the importance of the implementation of the bipartisan infrastructure law as we upgrade & modernize our energy infrastructure. https://t.co/09oiWF6XBR

I pressed David Crane, nominee to be Under Secretary of Energy for Infrastructure, on the importance of Alaska’s critical mineral resources and how the department is using the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act to address our critical mineral supply shortage. https://t.co/opVMhWDyv2
Today we take time to recognize our public health professionals who work tirelessly to ensure the safety and well-being of others. #PHTYD #PublicHealthHeroes https://t.co/49QlnyTqXW

The Holiday Mail for Heroes program, a special tradition held by the @TheRedCross, gives people a chance to send well wishes and express their gratitude to service members in the U.S. and abroad. https://t.co/e9wqSWW81C
This post did not come from me and I’m sorry for the confusion. I appreciate Alan’s service to Alaska.

I appreciate @alaskardc for hosting their annual conference—a chance to discuss Alaska’s fishing, forestry, mining, oil and gas, and tourism opportunities. I am excited for the future, because no one can match our potential. https://t.co/ktr2NSFZMt

Following last month’s harvests being canceled, declaring a fishery disaster for the Bering Sea snow crab and Bristol Bay red king crab fisheries is needed before Congress can secure assistance for fishing families, businesses, and communities that depend on the fisheries.

I led a letter w/ @SenDanSullivan, @SenatorCantwell, & @PattyMurray in calling @SecRaimondo to quickly declare a federal fishery disaster for the 2022-2023 Bering Sea snow crab, the 2022-2023 Bristol Bay red king crab, and the 2021-2022 Bristol Bay red king crab fisheries. https://t.co/wtwqFO1Ml9
The fall red king crab and the winter snow crab harvests being canceled was terrible news, for Alaska’s fishing and seafood industry and Alaska’s economy as a whole. https://t.co/Y9dOlUEDDC

Good news: more broadband funding announced for Alaska. As a result of the bipartisan infrastructure law, we continue to see investments to improve access, reliability, and affordably for communities across the state. https://t.co/1jrmpoGNa4

Happy to have met with students from the Kenai Peninsula Borough. @CloseUp_DC allows students to have once-in-a-lifetime opportunities & make personal connections here in Washington D.C. Students are the future of our country and we should do all we can to encourage them. https://t.co/UsyGSWI9YA
https://t.co/ce54NpwJiD

What’s great for Alaska’s economy, supported by labor groups, and an example of environmental justice? The @conocophillips Willow Project, which will cover 0.002% of the NPR-A while creating high-paying jobs, refilling our pipeline, and making gas more affordable. #ApproveWillow https://t.co/d2jZ6xf5lk
Meet Olive, our new office dog, celebrating #RockYourMocs. https://t.co/XA1sg0y3YW

Under the bipartisan infrastructure law @Interior & @USDA were required to complete a report outlining ways to improve the federal mineral permitting process within 1 yr of enactment. They failed to adhere to that deadline. 

They must be held accountable. https://t.co/msRkJF952K

The bipartisan infrastructure law is bringing clean water & broadband to every corner of Alaska, improving airports & expanding strategic ports, & has given the Alaska Marine Highway System a new lease on life.

For more info, visit the link below: https://t.co/rJ7xSVwFdH

One year ago the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act was signed into law and Alaskans are now receiving good news from it on a near-daily basis, with nearly $3 billion already announced for Alaska. https://t.co/4KsaO5cGbG
Senator McConnell has been a strong leader for our conference and I look forward to confirming him in our leadership elections this week.

We mark September 11 to remember those who perished that day and since then in the defense of our freedom. We honor them, we recommit to protecting our homeland, and we reflect on how America is at its best when united – not divided – in purpose and politics. [4 of 4]

The attacks that occurred on September 11 shook the foundation of America, but we did not crumble. Instead, we rallied, flew our flag high, and signaled to the world our steadfastness and resolve. [3 of 4]

On 9/11 & ever since, new generations of heroes & patriots have emerged. We remember & honor the first responders who courageously rescued their fellow Americans from the rubble that day, & the brave servicemen & women who have selflessly volunteered since then to serve. [2 of 4]

September 11 is a somber date for all Americans. Twenty-one years ago, our nation was attacked and 2,977 innocent lives were claimed by terrorists. Yet, even in the midst of heartbreaking loss our nation united and grew in strength.

We thank Congressman Young for everything he did for Alaska. We owe his family a debt of gratitude for sharing him with us for so long.  

Together with them, we mourn our late Congressman, Alaska’s champion and our dear friend, Don Young.

I am heartbroken. So are countless Alaskans, and individuals across the country who happened to meet this legendary legislator.  

We have lost a giant who we loved dearly and who held Alaska in his heart—always.

Our reality is that for the first time in 49 years, Alaska does not have a Congressman in the House of Representatives. For the first time in 49 years, Alaska does not have Don Young there to defend, advocate, and legislate on our behalf.

Being a Congressman for Alaska requires every last bit of you. It requires tremendous sacrifice, from you and your family. But from his first day through his last, Don Young gave it his all. He did the job better than anyone.

The record shows that Congressman Young was one of the best legislators of our time. Despite being just one of 435 voting members of the House, and the only one there to represent Alaska, he was repeatedly named one of his chamber’s most effective members.

If you thought Senator Stevens was legendary and tenacious in his pursuit of federal dollars to help build Alaska—just know that Congressman Young was right there with him, every step of the way, making sure Alaska received what we would call our fair share.

He passed legislation to open a small part of the non-wilderness 1002 Area, in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge, a dozen times before we steered it into law in 2017.  He never gave up, and his commitment to our energy security should be more appreciated than ever.
Congressman young helped establish the 200-mile fishing limit and contributed to the Magnuson-Stevens Act, which have allowed Alaska to maintain its world-class fisheries.

Congressman Young joined the U.S. House of Representatives in 1973. In his first year in office, he helped authorize the Trans-Alaska Pipeline, which has been Alaska's economic backbone ever since. Not long after, his colleagues chose him as the Freshman Congressman of the Year.

More than anything, Don was passionate about Alaska, and Alaskans, to his very core.  

And he was loyal and devoted—to his family, friends, and staff, and to the state and the people he loved so dearly.
@SenDanSullivan There is no doubt that Congressman Young lived a full life. He was 88 years young. He accomplished an incredible amount across the many decades he served Alaska and our country.

@rasmuson @ANSEP_AK With Ed’s passing, we have lost a leader and visionary, but his generous spirit lives on in his family and in the foundation they created. As we look back at his incredible life, Verne and I share our condolences with Cathy, Natasha, and all of their family and friends.

@rasmuson @ANSEP_AK I saw him make a fortune in business, and then use it to make a difference in the lives of Alaskans through philanthropy. That was Ed: always creating value for our state, and recognizing that Alaska’s real wealth is in the spirit of our people and the land itself.
@rasmuson @ANSEP_AK I have been lucky to know Ed for most of my life. I was a young girl living in Wrangell when he began his banking career there, and he has been a close family friend ever since.

After he retired from banking, Ed grew the @rasmuson  Foundation, where he continued to empower Alaska to be more independent & self-sustaining. He spent the past few decades giving back to people & communities in big and small ways, from the @ANSEP_AK to a playground in Yakutat.
As a banker, Ed focused on economic development, and the investments he made possible helped to build our young state.

The passing of Ed Rasmuson is a loss for all of us. 
 
Ed had a heart the size of Alaska, and dedicated his life to the state he loved so dearly. 
https://t.co/070rJ4z1G1

Alaskans have been blessed to have had Bud Fate as a friend and leader and one whose life story is woven into our state’s history.

Bud was a role model and a leader for so many Alaskans and one who served his family, his community and his country well. My deepest condolences to his daughters Janine, Jennifer, and Julie, and to my good friend Senator Dan Sullivan, as they mourn the loss of their father.

When there was a need to be met, Bud was always willing to help. He & his wife Mary Jane opened their home to those in need and worked together to advance opportunities for Alaska Natives. Bud & Mary Jane were life partners, and the love they shared was reflected in all they did.

He used his GI bill to put himself through dental school, was one of the first people to strike oil on the North Slope, and later in life he was elected to the Alaska State Legislature. I was fortunate to serve in the State House with Bud – he was truly one of my favorites.

I am deeply saddened by the passing of Bud Fate - my friend and a true Alaskan icon. Bud lived a full and incredible life. He served our country as a U.S. Army Veteran who was drafted during the Korean War and later helped map the ALCAN Highway for military use. https://t.co/fQ865uRtMl
